subject: Added the ability to block TFTP Upload in Firmware update.
commitMessage:
Added the ability to block TFTP Upload in Firmware update.

Signed-off-by: MichalX Szopinski <michalx.szopinski@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ic26d31ff6f6fc1fd03e11c318d7edceef4c335a3

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Ok-To-Test+1

User approved, CI ok to start

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build Successful 

https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/12770/ : SUCCESS

Patch Set 1:

Hi Michal, I'm currently working on making the firmware page more dynamic, including an update to how we're showing the TFTP upload option on this page. I started making these changes behind the ibm dotenv variable, with the intention to eventually update the default page also. I've posted the proposed design changes here https://github.com/openbmc/webui-vue/issues/44#issuecomment-781611937 

The change to address the TFTP upload is here https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/40526

I am still working on bringing these changes to the default build but have some work up in gerrit if you wanted to take a look
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/40722
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/40711

> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/40722

Ok, we also want to add all kind of files upload (not only *.tar) and disable "switch to running" button. Can we implement it in the same way (as TFTP) after your changes will be merged?
